events.name: Apps4VA HAC4EDU Richmond
events.about:
Apps4VA is sponsoring a 24-hour hackathon to develop software applications using education data. Cash and other prizes will be awarded to winners. Well supply food, snacks, and data. You supply energy, excitement and ingenuity!

Apps4VA is an collaborative effort between the Center for Innovative Technology and the Virginia Department of Education to encourage the develop of new and innovative ways to use and analyze education data.. For more information on the program, visit http://www.apps4va.org/index.html

events.name: RVA Hackathon
events.about: RVA Hackathon is a free, 24 hour event for developers and designers to hack on something theyve been meaning to tackle. Want to work with a team but dont have one? Present your idea at the beginning of the event and well get you teamed up with people that want to help. Want to go it alone with dedicated time? Have at it. At the end of the event well head out to the afterparty and present what was made by anyone who wants to share.

events.name: Hack on the Record
events.about:
The National Archives is holding its first ever hack day. (We think it might be the first one to be actually held inside a UK government department. But we could be wrong.)

We want to work with developers who share our interests in history, government and culture to devise and build systems using our records as well as datasets from across the web. Or to use a more technical term, build cool stuff.

We hold millions of documents covering almost a millennium of world history: everything from the Domesday Book and Cabinet Papers to the UK Government Web Archive and ourLegislation API.

Well have records experts from the Archives on hand together with colleagues from the British Museum, British Library and Wikimedia UK to talk about their data and to pitch ideas.

If youre not a coder - dont worry. Were also interested in paper prototyping, ontologies - even playdoh if you really want (as long as you keep it a long way from the documents). Its a weekend of making things.

Join us for challenges, jelly babies, manuscripts, public information films and pizza. But not necessarily in that order.

More details to follow...

#hackon12

Registration

All attendees are asked to bring some photo ID (driving licence, passport) for registration.
